image.altText: A white sedan stamped "certified shitbox"

props.synopsis: Recent strangers now lifelong friends after a week on the road have parted ways with their beloved "s***boxes" as the cancer research charity run culminated with an auction in Darwin on Saturday.

title.children: Beloved 's***boxes' find forever homes as charity rally comes to a close

image.altText: Horse racing at Brunette Downs track

props.synopsis: In the black-soil plains of the Barkly Tablelands, a champion racehorse called Rafferty Rules has etched itself into the history books.

title.children: 15yo 'Phar Lap of the Barkly' ends career with sixth Gold Cup on the trot

image.altText: A young girl using a walking aid, smiling as a woman nearby blows bubbles.

props.synopsis: The National Disability Insurance Agency is cutting travel allowances for physiotherapists, which some parents say will disadvantage their children living with disabilities — especially in regional and remote areas.

title.children: NDIS cuts to leave regional kids with less access to vital physiotherapy

image.altText: The Mayor Matt Paterson, wearing a white shirt sits at a table with a bell in the forefront.

props.synopsis: Matt Paterson campaigned as a "boring" mayor, but his term in a troubled part of Australia has been anything but dull — from wearing budgie smugglers at the airport, to regularly fronting national news and even calling for the sacking of the entire NT government.

title.children: 'There's no rule book': Alice Springs mayor to step down after eventful term

image.altText: Cuts of beef sit displayed in a butcher.

props.synopsis: Less than a decade after the red meat industry promised to reach net-zero emissions by 2030, it abandons the goal claiming it is not possible.

title.children: Cattle industry walks away from net-zero target by 2030 pledge

image.altText: A freight train travels through the outback with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Most "fresh" food travels thousands of kilometres to be sorted, divvied up and, in some cases, sent back to the place it came from — at huge cost to farmers and shoppers. But some new options are starting to sprout.

title.children: From freight to plate: The 'mind-boggling' journey of 'fresh' food

image.altText: A child and an adult crying.

props.synopsis: Israeli strikes have killed at least 72 people across Gaza overnight and into Saturday, according to Palestinian health workers, amid growing hopes for a ceasefire after 21 months of war.

title.children: Israeli strikes kill at least 72 people in Gaza as war rages on

image.altText: People walking, some holding cardboad boxes

props.synopsis: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu rejects a report in Israeli newspaper Haaretz that Israeli soldiers were ordered to shoot at Palestinians approaching aid sites in Gaza, calling the allegation a "malicious falsehood".

title.children: Netanyahu denies report IDF soldiers were told to shoot Gaza aid-seekers

image.altText: A woman stands in front of apartment buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's YIMBY movement is relatively new, but it is making an impact and each member has their own housing struggle spurring them on.

title.children: The deeply personal reasons Australians call themselves YIMBYs

image.altText: Massive crowd of people waving rainbow flags on bridge

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of protesters march through Hungary's capital as a banned LGBTQIA+ rights rally swells into a mass anti-government demonstration.

title.children: Hungary's banned Pride rally morphs into anti-government march

image.altText: A collage of two photos, one shows a young man in a suit at a table with a device, the other an older man holding an incubator.

props.synopsis: They developed electric vans and scooters in the 1940s, invented a portable heart monitor and saved thousands of people suffering from polio, so why aren't the Both brothers household names in Australia?

title.children: 'No-one's heard of them': Meet Australia's forgotten 'Edison' brothers

image.altText: A group of people stand around an ancient greek temple, dressed in summer clothes one woman holding an umbrella for shade.

props.synopsis: The temperature has been nearing 40 degrees Celsius in parts of Europe as the first heatwave of the summer hits continent.

title.children: European heatwave sends temperatures soaring

image.altText: A woman stand while holding a photo of herself and her husband in a photo frame.

props.synopsis: Heather Hughes' husband fought toxic fires for decades. But when he died of cancer WorkSafe rejected her dependency claim, despite recognising it as an occupational illness.

title.children: Mick died of cancer but his family's compensation claim was rejected

image.altText: Image shows authorities in neon green vests investigating a bookstore.

props.synopsis: Malaysian authorities raided this bookstore on Wednesday to seize two books on the grounds of morality. But for the bookstore staff and publishers, this is just another day.

title.children: The simple act of reading can be a crime in Malaysia. Here's why

image.altText: A coastal town next to blue water with sail boats

props.synopsis: As people in southern Australia flock to the tropics for the winter holidays, some popular destinations are looking to crack down on short-stay accommodation.

title.children: New limits on short stays proposed for Whitsunday region

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of the McLaren F1 Team drives during qualifying at the Red Bull Ring

props.synopsis: Australian F1 drivers' championship leader Oscar Piastri will start Sunday's Austrian Grand Prix third, while his teammate has stormed to pole position.

title.children: Piastri qualifies third for Austrian Grand Prix

image.altText: A mock up of a train on the Suburban Rail Loop

props.synopsis: Suburban Rail Loop Authority transport planners have calculated how much faster people will be able to between various destinations along the SRL East between Box Hill and Cheltenham, which is scheduled to open in 2035.

title.children: Suburban Rail Loop may shave up to 40 minutes from travel times in Melbourne's east

image.altText: A woman holding a small jar filled with white vitamins.

props.synopsis: A rise in the number of B6 toxicity cases across the nation has sparked action by the TGA to move products behind pharmacy counters.

title.children: 'Nerve damage': B6 recommended to come off shelves by TGA

image.altText: Man with cap and backpack holds a photo in one hand and a toy in the other in dwilight. Ute with headlights on in background.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill filmmaker Jason King is embarking on his most challenging project yet, telling his story of grief and loss after his daughter's death in the hope of helping others.

title.children: Father who lost 18yo daughter to suicide to honour her through film

image.altText: A young boy sitting in his dad's lap laughs with his mum, who is sitting by his side smiling at him.

props.synopsis: The mother of a child who featured in a state government autism announcement says she feels "let down" as her son struggles in the school system.

title.children: Mum says she feels let down by SA government's autism strategy

image.altText: man holding new suitcase

props.synopsis: The circular economy is flourishing as Australians upcycle and even sell the unsellable at op shops and second-hand dealers.

title.children: Learning to repurpose, resell and recycle is a win for purses and planet

image.altText: Woman with blonde hair hugs rooster

props.synopsis: A Townsville rooster rescue and re-homing group says rooster dumping is on the rise with an increase in the popularity of backyard chickens.

title.children: Rooster rescue group offers birds a second chance in 'bachelor flock'

image.altText: A woman wearing black prepares coffee at French-style cafe.

props.synopsis: Much of Australia's French-speaking population has found their chosen homes in Killarney Heights, fit with Parisian cafes, French language classes and champagne-stocked bottle shops.

title.children: How a sleepy Sydney suburb became the French capital of Australia

image.altText: A man holding a caracal

props.synopsis: Under the cover of darkness, and with artillery fire just kilometres away, Marcus Fillinger rescued an emaciated wolf that had been abandoned for weeks in a private zoo in Ukraine.

title.children: Why this Aussie drove a sedated wolf through war-torn Ukraine

image.altText: Alex de Minaur poses for a photo with two kids at Wimbledon

props.synopsis: Having taken an extended break after his French Open disaster, Alex de Minaur says he is feeling refreshed and ready to go deep at Wimbledon.

title.children: Relaxed and refreshed de Minaur says there will be 'no excuses' at Wimbledon

image.altText: Harley Reid stands up in a tackle and looks to handball as three Collingwood players try to stop him

props.synopsis: The Magpies lift when required against the bottom-placed Eagles, recording a 29-point win at Docklands, while the Hawks and Suns also celebrate victories.

title.children: Eagles coach to contact AFL over holding the ball calls in loss to Pies

image.altText: a woman with red hair and glasses talks animatedly to a man with grey hair and beard who is facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Sally Shrapnel had been a GP for more than two decades when she decided to pursue her childhood dream of becoming a full-time physicist.

title.children: How a GP took a quantum leap to become a leading physicist

image.altText: Maya Joint smiles while holding up a large trophy

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Maya Joint receives the perfect pre-Wimbledon boost, winning the Eastbourne Open for her first grass-court title.

title.children: Maya Joint digs deep for maiden grass-court title at Eastbourne Open

image.altText: a weather graph over nsw of a forecast weather bomb

props.synopsis: Forget the headlines and hyperbole of the fictitious "rain bomb" — the real weather bomb is possible along Australia's east coast next week.

title.children: 'Bomb cyclone' ahead for Australia's east coast

image.altText: Lauren Sanchez in a floral wedding dress and Jeff Bezos in a suit.

props.synopsis: The sky itself is no limit for billionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancée Lauren Sánchez and expectations were about as high ahead of their wedding in Venice.

title.children: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's Venice wedding in pictures

image.altText: Donald Trump, seated at his desk, holds up a signed piece of paper as three men and a woman stand behind him looking on.

props.synopsis: While the deal could be a turning point in the struggle to end the conflict, many Congolese see the deal mainly as an opportunity for the US to acquire Congo's critical minerals.

title.children: DRC and Rwanda sign US-mediated peace deal to end bloody conflict

image.altText: A man in a suit stands with his arms out behind a lectern, with two other men in suits standing either side of him

props.synopsis: The US president says he would consider further military action in Iran, as the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade confirms 3,200 Australians and family members in the country register with a crisis service.

title.children: Trump says he could bomb Iran again, as DFAT crisis register grows

image.altText: Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow of the Dolphins makes a Dolphin gesture in celebration

props.synopsis: Star fullbacks Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow and Reece Walsh shine on Saturday, with the vacant number one jersey for the Queensland Maroons up for grabs.

title.children: Hammer scores four, Walsh stars with Maroons fullback spot up for grabs

image.altText: Tomos Williams leaves the field injured for the British and Irish Lions.

props.synopsis: Henry Pollock shows off his star potential, but teammate Tomos Williams is cut down by a hamstring injury as the British and Irish Lions hand the Western Force a crushing defeat in Perth.

title.children: British and Irish Lions suffer injury blow in 54-7 win over Western Force

image.altText: A man with a big black and grey beard stands with his arms crossed.

props.synopsis: From online crusader to censured councillor, Big Rob's little fights have become big problems for a regional city still recovering from natural disasters.

title.children: Is this man Australia's most divisive local councillor?
